articles.title: Investors predict AI is coming for labor in 2026
articles.description: The exact impact AI will have on the enterprise labor market is unclear but investors predict trends will start to emerge in 2026.
articles.author: Rebecca Szkutak
articles.content: The exact impact AI will have on the enterprise labor market is unclear but investors predict trends will start to emerge in 2026.

articles.title: AI agent-driven browser automation for enterprise workflow management
articles.description: Enterprise organizations increasingly rely on web-based applications for critical business processes, yet many workflows remain manually intensive, creating operational inefficiencies and compliance risks. Despite significant technology investments, knowledge workers routinely navigate between eight to twelve different web applications during standard workflows, constantly switching contexts and manually transferring information between systems. Data entry and validation tasks […]
articles.author: Kosti Vasilakakis
articles.content: Enterprise organizations increasingly rely on web-based applications for critical business processes, yet many workflows remain manually intensive, creating operational inefficiencies and compliance risks. articles.title: CES 2026: How to watch Sony Honda Afeela’s presentation
articles.description: Sony Honda Mobility will stream its CES 2026 press conference live from Las Vegas on Monday, January 5, 2026, at 8 p.m. ET via the Afeela official YouTube channel. The event centers on electric vehicles from the Sony-Honda joint venture, highlighting the Afeela 1 model. The press conference occupies the traditional end-of-press-day slot at CES. […]

articles.title: A Coding Implementation of an OpenAI-Assisted Privacy-Preserving Federated Fraud Detection System from Scratch Using Lightweight PyTorch Simulations
articles.description: In this tutorial, we demonstrate how we simulate a privacy-preserving fraud detection system using Federated Learning without relying on heavyweight frameworks or complex infrastructure. We build a clean, CPU-friendly setup that mimics ten independent banks, each training a local fraud-detection model on its own highly imbalanced transaction data. We coordinate these local updates through a […] The post A Coding Implementation of an OpenAI-Assisted Privacy-Preserving Federated Fraud Detection...
articles.author: Asif Razzaq
articles.content: In this tutorial, we demonstrate how we simulate a privacy-preserving fraud detection system using Federated Learning without relying on heavyweight frameworks or complex infrastructure. We build a clean, CPU-friendly setup that mimics ten independent banks, each training a local fraud-detection model on its own highly imbalanced transaction data. articles.title: Amazon blocks 1800 North Korean operatives from remote jobs
articles.description: Amazon has blocked more than 1,800 suspected North Korean operatives from remote information technology jobs since April 2024. Stephen Schmidt, the company’s second senior vice president and chief security officer, detailed the effort in a LinkedIn post in late December 2025. North Korean nationals seek these positions at U.S. companies to funnel wages toward the […]
articles.author: Emre Çıtak
articles.content: Amazon has blocked more than 1,800 suspected North Korean operatives from remote information technology jobs since April 2024. articles.title: Deploy Mistral AI’s Voxtral on Amazon SageMaker AI
articles.description: In this post, we demonstrate hosting Voxtral models on Amazon SageMaker AI endpoints using vLLM and the Bring Your Own Container (BYOC) approach. vLLM is a high-performance library for serving large language models (LLMs) that features paged attention for improved memory management and tensor parallelism for distributing models across multiple GPUs.
articles.author: Ying Hou
articles.content: In this post, we demonstrate hosting Voxtral models on Amazon SageMaker AI endpoints using vLLM and the Bring Your Own Container (BYOC) approach. vLLM is a high-performance library for serving large language models (LLMs) that features paged attention for improved memory management and tensor parallelism for distributing models across multiple GPUs.

articles.title: Accelerate Enterprise AI Development using Weights & Biases and Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
articles.description: In this post, we demonstrate how to use Foundation Models (FMs) from Amazon Bedrock and the newly launched Amazon Bedrock AgentCore alongside W&B Weave to help build, evaluate, and monitor enterprise AI solutions. We cover the complete development lifecycle from tracking individual FM calls to monitoring complex agent workflows in production.
articles.author: James Yi
articles.content: In this post, we demonstrate how to use Foundation Models (FMs) from Amazon Bedrock and the newly launched Amazon Bedrock AgentCore alongside W&B Weave to help build, evaluate, and monitor enterprise AI solutions. We cover the complete development lifecycle from tracking individual FM calls to monitoring complex agent workflows in production.

articles.title: The European startup market’s data doesn’t match its energy — yet
articles.description: Europe's startup market hasn't produced meaningful numbers but there is reason to believe the data will start to change.
articles.author: Rebecca Szkutak
articles.content: Europe's startup market hasn't produced meaningful numbers but there is reason to believe the data will start to change.

articles.title: The 10 most viewed publications of 2025
articles.description: From foundation model safety frameworks and formal verification at cloud scale to advanced robotics and multimodal AI reasoning, these are the most viewed publications from Amazon scientists and collaborators in 2025.
articles.author: Staff writer
articles.content: From foundation model safety frameworks and formal verification at cloud scale to advanced robotics and multimodal AI reasoning, these are the most viewed publications from Amazon scientists and collaborators in 2025.

articles.title: Build a multimodal generative AI assistant for root cause diagnosis in predictive maintenance using Amazon Bedrock
articles.description: In this post, we demonstrate how to implement a predictive maintenance solution using Foundation Models (FMs) on Amazon Bedrock, with a case study of Amazon's manufacturing equipment within their fulfillment centers. The solution is highly adaptable and can be customized for other industries, including oil and gas, logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare.
articles.author: Carla Lorente
articles.content: In this post, we demonstrate how to implement a predictive maintenance solution using Foundation Models (FMs) on Amazon Bedrock, with a case study of Amazon's manufacturing equipment within their fulfillment centers. The solution is highly adaptable and can be customized for other industries, including oil and gas, logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare.

articles.title: NIH-led study reveals role of mobile DNA elements in lung cancer progression
articles.description: Sherlock-Lung study researchers use large-scale, multi-omics analysis to identify biomarker of aggressive lung tumors.
articles.content: Sherlock-Lung study researchers use large-scale, multi-omics analysis to identify biomarker of aggressive lung tumors.

articles.title: DagsHub now supports MLflow 3.x
articles.description: We’ve shipped support for MLflow 3.x on DagsHub, so you can upgrade your MLflow client and keep using the same hosted tracking server that lives inside every DagsHub repo. No self-hosting, no extra infra, no “where did my artifacts go?” moments.
articles.author: Dean Pleban
articles.content: We’ve shipped support for MLflow 3.x on DagsHub, so you can upgrade your MLflow client and keep using the same hosted tracking server that lives inside every DagsHub repo. No self-hosting, no extra infra, no “where did my artifacts go?” moments.

articles.title: How to Design Transactional Agentic AI Systems with LangGraph Using Two-Phase Commit, Human Interrupts, and Safe Rollbacks
articles.description: In this tutorial, we implement an agentic AI pattern using LangGraph that treats reasoning and action as a transactional workflow rather than a single-shot decision. We model a two-phase commit system in which an agent stages reversible changes, validates strict invariants, pauses for human approval via graph interrupts, and commits or rolls back only then. […] The post How to Design Transactional Agentic AI Systems with LangGraph Using Two-Phase Commit, Human Interrupts, and Safe Rollbacks...

articles.content: In this tutorial, we implement an agentic AI pattern using LangGraph that treats reasoning and action as a transactional workflow rather than a single-shot decision. We model a two-phase commit system in which an agent stages reversible changes, validates strict invariants, pauses for human approval via graph interrupts, and commits or rolls back only then.
